primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The modern human (Subject) experiences a lack of spiritual power/peace (Object) despite material abundance. The Subject must 'appropriate' or 'climb above' circumstances to obtain this interior supply.

tekstueel_bewijs: You and I have countless visible supplies but lack those invisible supplies
we Americans are the most mobile nation
we are the same restless, discontented, uneasy people

object.identificatie: Invisible spiritual supplies / Interior wealth / Power / Peace
tekstueel_bewijs: deep, invisible interior supplies of the spirit

zender.identificatie: God / The Gospel (as a source of availability)
tekstueel_bewijs: The world cannot give this, but God can give it
It is a part of our spiritual birthright
available to any person who will have it
There is a scene in the life of Jesus which strikingly sets this forth

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not Sin or Death as cosmic powers, but 'circumstances' and 'restlessness' that make life 'lame'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical mandate to change the world's physical conditions.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Christians / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests we must work for the world (Secondary) while maintaining inner peace (Primary), but the Primary is needed to sustain the Secondary.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Jesus' Example → The Hearer ← Modern Circumstances

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we seem to have so little worth saying
You can move in the midst of disaster

voorbeelden: We must work for physical changes
available to any person who will have it
meat to eat that ye know not of
we discovered in the gallant odyssey
you need not be determined by your circumstances
by which you can determine your circumstance

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on awakening the hearer's desire (Vouloir) to access a power that is already 'available'. It assumes the hearer has the inherent capacity to 'appropriate' if they choose.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Material abundance) to ~S1 (Spiritual lack), then using Jesus as a bridge to S1 (Interior wealth) regardless of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through 'Appropriation'—a mental/spiritual act of the Subject to rise above the material.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low. S2 is treated as 'shifting circumstances' rather than the 'Judgment of God' or 'Death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses the word 'Gospel' and 'God', the actantial Subject is consistently the human 'I' or 'We'. God is the provider of a resource, but the human is the one who must 'appropriate', 'climb', and 'determine' their life. It is a 'Gospel of Availability' rather than a 'Gospel of Rescue'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: This is a capacity and a power available to any person who will have it.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ, very man, very God, did get hungry and thirsted

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is used as the primary example of someone who had 'invisible supplies'. Lindbergh and the Slave spirituals are used as parallel models for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of Jesus having supplies we should copy, the sermon could focus on Jesus being the Supply who feeds the spiritually dead.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'climb higher' or 'appropriate' more effectively; potential for exhaustion.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human will is the deciding factor in sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically bifurcated between social responsibility and interior escapism.
spanning_punten: The call to change the world vs. the call to live 'above' circumstances.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: There is a scene in the life of Jesus which strikingly sets this forth.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is a 'supply' to be used by the Subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'deranged manifestations' and 'shallow chatter' rather than total depravity.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech where God is the battery and the Hearer is the operator. The narrative engine is fueled by human 'appropriation'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'obtaining' peace.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who 'bestows' or 'invades' the restless heart.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Appropriate it now', use 'Christ has seized you with a peace that the world cannot take away'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with the 'thirst' of the woman, and Christ as the one who gives the water.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit creates the 'willing' where it is absent.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as the spiritual death that no human 'climbing' can escape.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Only a heavy opponent necessitates a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics and Soteriology are fused into 'self-improvement'.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ provides the meat (Soteriology). 2. Because we are fed, we serve (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has beautiful imagery but risks leaving the hearer burdened by the need to 'appropriate' their own strength. Shift the active verbs to God to truly proclaim Grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is masterful (Lindbergh/Slaves imagery). Actantially, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of John 4 usually focuses on Jesus as the Living Water; here he is a model of interiority.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Gospel' vocabulary, the 'Subject' of the verbs remains the human ego.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon leans heavily on the 'Spirit of St. Louis' metaphor, which reinforces the Subject-as-Pilot actantial role.
